properties.notes_pt: Tempo em fam√≠lia, anivers√°rio da v√≥ e do Pedrinho, preparativos pra viagem e come√ßo da aventura!
properties.notes_en: Family time, grandma and Pedrinho's birthdays, travel preparations, and the start of the adventure!

properties.notes_pt: Primeiro dia da viagem foi um sucesso! Belas paisagens do litoral norte do RN, uma travessia de balsa, um trecho dificil na areia fofa e os √∫ltimos 30 km de BR 101 at√© o fim dela. Bati um PF em Cajueiro e achei um lugar seguro pra acampar na varanda de uma casa, de frente pro mar. Deu pra nadar no mar, tomar uma ducha e lavar roupa. 20h j√° tava deitado pra dormir
properties.notes_en: The first day of the trip was a success! Beautiful scenery on the northern coast of Rio Grande do Norte, a ferry crossing, a difficult stretch on soft sand, and the last 30 km on the BR 101 highway to the end. I had a meal in Cajueiro and found a safe place to camp on the porch of a house facing the sea. I was able to swim in the sea, take a shower, and wash my clothes. By 8 pm, I was already lying down to sleep.

properties.notes_pt: Passei por S√£o Miguel do Gostoso, e depois de Tourinhos o primeiro trecho pela areia da praia! Na mar√© seca, entre o mar e as e√≥licas. 30 km de estrada de terra ruim pesou, enfim em Pedra Grande almocei na Dona Marta, descansei e peguei o trecho final de asfalto com vento nas costas at√© Cai√ßara do Norte, onde me indicaram um local seguro pra acampar. Mergulho no mar e belo p√¥r do sol. Hamilton desenrolou uma mangueira pra eu tomar banho. Fiz minha janta, meu acampamentinho e conversei com umas crian√ßas que tavam ali brincando, com√©dias.
properties.notes_en: I passed through S√£o Miguel do Gostoso, and after Tourinhos, the first stretch along the beach sand! At low tide, between the sea and the wind turbines. 30 km of rough dirt road took its toll, but finally in Pedra Grande I had lunch at Dona Marta's, rested and took the final stretch of asphalt with the wind at my back to Cai√ßara do Norte, where they recommended a safe place to camp. I went for a swim in the sea and enjoyed a beautiful sunset. Hamilton unrolled a hose so I could take a shower. I made my dinner, set up my little camp and chatted with some children who were playing there, having fun.

properties.notes_pt: 25 km de pedal na areia na mar√© seca, muito bom! Passando por um trecho deserto, depois Galos e enfim Galinhos, um dos pequenos para√≠sos do RN. Passei a maior parte do dia, dei uma volta, curti a praia, almocei, vegetei, e desenrolei um barco pra ir pra Guamar√© no fim do dia.
properties.notes_en: 25 km of pedalling on the sand at low tide, very nice! Passing through a deserted stretch, then Galos and finally Galinhos, one of RN's little paradises. I spent most of the day walking around, enjoying the beach, having lunch, 'vegetating' and catching a boat to Guamar√© at the end of the day.

properties.notes_pt: Lindo por do sol no barco pra Guamar√© com o barqueiro Peluzio e outra menina. Chegando l√° fiquei prospectando um local pra dormir, at√© que optei pelo coreto de uma pra√ßa,  j√° tava bem instalado fazendo minha massa quando um senhor, seu Fran√ßa, 87 anos, veio me oferecer um quarto pra dormir. O luxo, uma su√≠te, foi √≥timo.  Gratid√£o seu Fran√ßa <3
properties.notes_en: Beautiful sunset on the boat to Guamar√© with the boatman Peluzio and another girl. When I got there, I was looking for a place to sleep, until I opted for the bandstand in a square. I was already well settled into my pasta when a man, Seu Fran√ßa, 87, offered me a room to sleep in. The luxury, a suite, was great.  Thank you, Mr Fran√ßa <3

properties.notes_pt: Entrei na regi√£o produtora de sal e petr√≥leo do RN, muitas salinas pelo caminho, ainda umas e√≥licas tamb√©m. Alguns trechos desolados quase des√©rticos. Almocei e descansei em Pend√™ncias.
properties.notes_en: I entered the salt and oil producing region of RN, many salt flats along the way, and a few wind farms too. Some desolate, almost desert-like stretches. I had lunch and rested in Pend√™ncias.

properties.notes_pt: A parte da tarde foi dif√≠cil com estrada bem ruim e alguns trechos contra o vento (mas no geral tenho que agradecer o vento pois ele costuma ajudar). Fim da tarde cheguei na praia do Rosado, no munic√≠pio de Porto do Mangue, onde seu Raimundo e fam√≠lia me receberam pra passar a noite. Dei o tradicional tibum e banho. Vento muito forte ali, a casa cheia de areia. Jantei uma sopa com a fam√≠lia. Achei legal que a fam√≠lia forma uma verdadeira comunidade de dezenas de pessoas lado a lado. Dormi na rede na varanda, foi agrad√°vel.
properties.notes_en: The afternoon was difficult, with very bad roads and some stretches against the wind (but in general I have the wind to thank, as it usually helps). In the late afternoon I arrived at Rosado beach, in the municipality of Porto do Mangue, where Raimundo and his family welcomed me for the night. I took the traditional swim and a shower. It was very windy there, and the house was full of sand. I had soup for dinner with the family. I thought it was nice that the family forms a real community of dozens of people side by side. I slept in the hammock on the veranda, it was nice.

properties.notes_pt: Voei de manh√£ pra conseguir pegar a balsa de 8h30 de Areia Branca pra Grossos. Fiz uma longa pausa em Tibau, conversei com uns ciclistas que me deram coca e gelo. Primeira fronteira estadual, entrei no Cear√°! Almocei no centrinho de Icapu√≠ e cheguei de tarde na praia do Peroba, onde fui super bem recebido por uma fam√≠lia linda que trabalha com prote√ß√£o dos peixes boi. E o espa√ßo muito bom com bela vista pro mar. Acabei ficando umas 48h de boa, encontros potentes e aprendizados!
properties.notes_en: I left in the morning to catch the 8.30am ferry from Areia Branca to Grossos. I took a long break in Tibau, chatted to some cyclists who gave me coke and ice. First state border, I've entered Cear√°! I had lunch in the centre of Icapu√≠ and arrived in the afternoon at Peroba beach, where I was warmly welcomed by a lovely family who work to protect manatees. It's a very nice place with a beautiful view of the sea. I ended up staying there for 48 hours, meeting people and learning a lot!

properties.notes_pt: Dia tranquilo no Peroba, brincando com as crian√ßas. Parti de tarde, pedalei s√≥ 2 horinhas at√© Canoa Quebrada, onde vi um lindo p√¥r do sol. Acampei nos fundos de uma barraca/bar de praia.
properties.notes_en: A quiet day in Peroba, playing with the children. I left in the afternoon and cycled just two hours to Canoa Quebrada, where I saw a beautiful sunset. I camped at the back of a beach hut/bar.

properties.notes_pt: Fiquei um pouco em Canoa Quebrada, at√© tive uma sess√£o de terapia na loja de conveni√™ncia de um posto de gasolina, fui sair s√≥ umas 11h j√° sob o ma√ßarico impiedoso do sol. Fui seguindo a rodovia estadual pouco interessante. Interessante foram as coisas a beira da estrada como coco 2 reais, d√∫zia de cajus 5 reais e por a√≠ vai. Cheguei no fim da tarde em Morro Branco perto da praia das Fontes, casal Jairo e Nice me receberam de gra√ßa no camping deles, gratid√£o!
properties.notes_en: I stayed in Canoa Quebrada for a while, even had a therapy session in the convenience store of a petrol station, but left only at 11am, already under the merciless torch of the sun. I followed the uninteresting state road. What was interesting were the things on the side of the road like coconuts for 2 reais, a dozen cashews for 5 reais and so on. I arrived in the late afternoon in Morro Branco near Praia das Fontes. Jairo and Nice welcomed me for free at their campsite, thank you!

properties.notes_pt: De manh√£ passei na Praia das Fontes, tomei um banho de mar e tirei √°gua salgada nas bicas depois foi boa parte do dia seguindo a estrada mesmo at√© entrar em Fortaleza e chegar em Ancuri, onde fui muito bem recebido pela minha prima Gabi e seu marido Call, pude tirar um cochilo e rolou churrasco e resenha.
properties.notes_en: In the morning I stopped by Praia das Fontes, took a sea bath and rinsed off the salt water at the springs. Then I spent most of the day following the road until entering Fortaleza and arriving in Ancuri, where I was warmly welcomed by my cousin Gabi and her husband Call. I was able to take a nap, and we had a barbecue and good conversation.

properties.notes_pt: Tirei um dia de descanso na casa de Gabi e Call, foi √≥timo passar esse tempo com eles e os bichos. Inclusive, deu pra remendar primeiro pneu furado da viagem. S√°bado de manh√£ parti, como previsto foi meio chato atravessar Fortaleza quase inteira, tr√¢nsito movimentado. Chegando no litoral ficou mais tranquilo, fui at√© o Pec√©m e fiz o trecho final at√© Ta√≠ba pela praia. Lindo lugar, point de kite e de surf.
properties.notes_en: I took a rest day at Gabi and Call‚Äôs house ‚Äî it was great spending time with them and the pets. I even got to patch the first flat tire of the trip. On Saturday morning I set off; as expected, crossing almost all of Fortaleza was a bit annoying due to heavy traffic. Once I reached the coast it got more peaceful. I went through Pec√©m and did the final stretch to Ta√≠ba along the beach. Beautiful place, a spot for kitesurfing and surfing.

properties.notes_pt: Dia puxado porque foi uns 20 km de 'cal√ßamento' terr√≠vel trepidando muito, e pra completar o amortecedor tava travado e eu n√£o conseguia destravar. Em Po√ßo Doce Jo√£o e amigos muito gentis me deram sopa e coca, conversamos um pouco, at√© me convidaram pra almo√ßar mesmo mas eu n√£o queria perder o hor√°rio da mar√© baixa; fiz o trecho final de Lagoinha at√© Flecheiras pela praia. Enfim deu pra relaxar no mar e achei um local √≥timo pra acampar ali na praia mesmo.
properties.notes_en: Tough day, as there were about 20 km of terrible cobblestone road shaking a lot, and to top it off the shock absorber was stuck and I couldn‚Äôt unlock it. In Po√ßo Doce, Jo√£o and some kind friends gave me soup and coke; we chatted for a while and they even invited me for lunch, but I didn‚Äôt want to miss the low tide. I did the final stretch from Lagoinha to Flecheiras along the beach. Finally, I got to relax in the sea and found a great spot to camp right there on the beach.

properties.notes_pt: Dia mais longo de pedal at√© ent√£o, 115 km, mas s√≥ no asfalto. Cheguei no fim da tarde, muita gente (muitos gringos inclusive) fazendo kite na lagoa, que na verdade √© um bra√ßo de mar. Acabei armando minha rede debaixo do deck da pra√ßa, mais protegido do vento e j√° na areia. De manh√£ inusitadamente fui acordado por uma missa logo acima de mim √†s 5h. Sa√≠ pra passear na lagoa e na praia do lado oce√¢nico. Infelizmente nesse meio tempo algu√©m furtou minha power bank. Fui partir s√≥ na hora do almo√ßo.
properties.notes_en: Longest cycling day so far ‚Äî 115 km, all on asphalt. I arrived in the late afternoon; lots of people (many foreigners too) were kitesurfing on the lagoon, which is actually a sea inlet. I ended up setting up my hammock under the deck at the square, sheltered from the wind and right on the sand. In the morning, I was unexpectedly woken up by a mass right above me at 5 a.m. I went for a walk by the lagoon and the beach on the ocean side. Unfortunately, in the meantime, someone stole my power bank. I left just in time for lunch.

properties.notes_pt: Almocei em Itarema e pedalei uns 50 km at√© a praia de Arana√∫, onde acampei numa casa desocupada e os vizinhos gentilmente cederam um banheiro com chuveiro. Encontro marcante nessa casa: achei uma gatinha rec√©m nascida abandonada, chorando. A protegi do vento e dei leite (descobri que √© ruim pra filhotes t√£o pequenos). Ela dormiu comigo na rede dentro do bolso do meu moletom. Resolvi levar ela comigo pra levar no veterin√°rio. Sa√≠mos √†s 5h da manh√£ pegando belo nascer do sol pela praia.
properties.notes_en: I had lunch in Itarema and cycled about 50 km to Arana√∫ Beach, where I camped in an unoccupied house and the neighbors kindly let me use a bathroom with a shower. A remarkable encounter there: I found a newborn kitten abandoned and crying. I sheltered her from the wind and gave her milk (later found out it‚Äôs not good for such young kittens). She slept with me in the hammock, inside my hoodie pocket. I decided to take her with me to see a vet. We left at 5 a.m., catching a beautiful sunrise along the beach.

properties.notes_pt: Dia de emo√ß√µes. Pedalei uns 20 km pela praia at√© o Pre√°, castigando a coitada da Nat√°lia (bike) com areia e √°gua salgada. E a gatinha no bolso do quadro tamb√©m reclamando de vez em quando. Pouco antes de chegar, um lado do meu alforge rasgou feio, tive que fazer uma gambiarra com um el√°stico pra segurar. No Pre√°, consegui levar a gatinha no pet shop, onde comprei e dei leite apropriado pra rec√©m nascidos. A veterin√°ria deu algumas orienta√ß√µes. At√© pensei em levar a gata comigo, mas ela √© muito pequenina e precisa de conforto e estabilidade, coisa que viajando de bike ela n√£o teria. Acabei ajudando com mais leites e a veterin√°ria ficou com ela at√© achar algu√©m pra adotar. Tamb√©m no Pre√° o camarada Asef costurou meu alforge, salvou. De tarde segui pra Cai√ßara ficar no camping Proibido N√£o Viver, pra ter mais conforto e por curiosidade de conhecer o casal viajante Renan e Larissa. Acabei ficando 2,5 dias e conheci muita gente bacana, v√°rios viajantes de bom cora√ß√£o. Rolou barzinho, pizza at√© karaoke e m√∫sica ao vivo! Tamb√©m passeei pelos buracos verde e azul e a lagoa do para√≠so.
properties.notes_en: An emotional day. I cycled about 20 km along the beach to Pre√°, giving poor Nat√°lia (my bike) a hard time with sand and salt water. The kitten in the frame pocket was also complaining from time to time. Shortly before arriving, one side of my pannier tore badly, and I had to improvise a fix with an elastic band. In Pre√°, I managed to take the kitten to a pet shop, where I bought proper milk for newborns. The vet gave me some guidance. I even thought about keeping her with me, but she‚Äôs too tiny and needs comfort and stability ‚Äî things impossible on a bike trip. I helped by buying more milk, and the vet agreed to keep her until finding someone to adopt her. Also in Pre√°, a guy named Asef sewed my pannier ‚Äî saved it! In the afternoon, I continued to Cai√ßara to stay at the 'Proibido N√£o Viver' camping, both for comfort and curiosity to meet the traveling couple Renan and Larissa. I ended up staying two and a half days, meeting lots of great people and kind-hearted travelers. There was a bar, pizza, karaoke, and even live music! I also visited some beautiful lagoons.

properties.notes_pt: Ap√≥s uns dias tranquilos em Cai√ßara, voltei a pedalar. Foi pouco mas deu pra cansar entre o Pre√° e Jeri, trechos de areia fofa tendo que empurrar a bike, e no fim a subida do Serrote. Mas que vista! E a descida deu pra curtir, no modo Nat MTB. Acabei ficando num camping tamb√©m em Jeri, almocei, cochilei e curti uma praia e p√¥r do sol das dunas.
properties.notes_en: After a few relaxing days in Cai√ßara, I got back on the bike. It wasn‚Äôt a long ride, but it was tiring between Pre√° and Jeri, with stretches of soft sand where I had to push the bike, and finally the climb up the Serrote hill. But what a view! The downhill was pure fun, Nat MTB mode. I ended up staying at a camping spot in Jeri as well, had lunch, took a nap, and enjoyed the beach and sunset from the dunes.

properties.notes_pt: Pedalei 40 km pela praia de manh√£, de Jeri at√© Camocim. O maior trecho de praia na viagem, felizmente em sua grande maioria com areia bem firme, e claro o vento nas costas sempre ajudando. Gratid√£o aos camaradas das balsas que n√£o me cobraram a travessia, tanto em Guri√∫ quanto pra Camocim. E gratid√£o aos camaradas de um restaurante em Camocim que n√£o s√≥ me deram a √°gua que eu tinha pedido pra lavar a bike, como me deram um prato de comida! üôå Tirei um leve cochilo numa pra√ßa esperando o sol baixar um pouco, onde conheci o PGH (pequeno grande homem), um noia local. Enfim mais 40 km at√© Barroquinha, j√° perto do Piau√≠! Tomei um banho num posto, comi um podr√£o na pra√ßa e acampei nela mesmo, cansado.
properties.notes_en: I cycled 40 km along the beach in the morning, from Jeri to Camocim ‚Äî the longest beach stretch of the trip, fortunately with mostly firm sand and, of course, the tailwind always helping. Grateful to the ferry guys who didn‚Äôt charge me for the crossings, both at Guri√∫ and to Camocim. And thanks to the folks at a restaurant in Camocim who not only gave me the water I asked for to wash the bike but also served me a plate of food! üôå I took a short nap in a square waiting for the sun to ease off, where I met PGH (Pequeno Grande Homem), a local wanderer. Finally, another 40 km to Barroquinha, already close to Piau√≠! Took a shower at a gas station, had a big street burger at the square, and camped there, exhausted.

properties.notes_pt: Cheguei no Piau√≠! Primeira vez nesse Estado. Resolvi fazer curso de kitesurf, que eu estava h√° muito tempo querendo e tenho passado por excelentes locais para a pr√°tica e na √©poca ideal. Fiquei no Borogodo, um hostel desativado onde fiz um combinado com a dona Amanda. Acabei ficando noites, entre curso de kite, ficar de boa na rede e roles com o pessoal ali da casa. Foi √≥timo pra recarregar as energias!
properties.notes_en: I arrived in Piau√≠ ‚Äî my first time in this state! I decided to take kitesurfing lessons, something I‚Äôd been wanting to do for a long time, and I‚Äôve been passing through amazing spots for it at the perfect time of year. I stayed at Borogod√≥, a deactivated hostel where I made an arrangement with the owner, Amanda. I ended up staying a few nights, between kite lessons, relaxing in the hammock, and hanging out with the people at the house. It was great to recharge my energy!

properties.notes_pt: O dia de Barra Grande pra Parna√≠ba foi inusitado. Peguei uma carona (paga) na lancha de um banana boat at√© a praia de Macap√°. L√° conheci uma fam√≠lia muito gente boa e passamos boa parte do dia juntos, primeiro ali na praia, depois almocei na casa deles, fomos em outra praia Maramar, conheci a irm√£/tia, um barzinho com um bode. Depois nos reencontramos em Atalaia 20 km adiante (nesse meio tempo estraguei o bico da c√¢mara e tive que botar a reserva üò¨) pro por do sol e um evento de corrida. Obrigado aos novos amigos! Enfim segui j√° escurecendo at√© Parna√≠ba, onde fui muito bem recebido pelo Leo, meu host de couchsurfing. No dia seguinte, domingo, fiz o passeio de barco no delta do Parna√≠ba, muito bom!
properties.notes_en: The day from Barra Grande to Parna√≠ba was quite unusual. I hitched a (paid) ride on a banana boat‚Äôs motor launch to Macap√° Beach. There I met a really nice family, and we spent most of the day together ‚Äî first on the beach, then I had lunch at their house, we went to another beach called Maramar, met the sister/aunt, and even stopped by a bar with a goat. Later, we met again in Atalaia, 20 km ahead (in the meantime I damaged my tube valve and had to use the spare üò¨) to watch the sunset and a running event. Thanks to these new friends! Finally, as night was falling, I continued to Parna√≠ba, where I was warmly welcomed by Leo, my Couchsurfing host. The next day, Sunday, I did a boat tour through the Parna√≠ba Delta ‚Äî amazing experience!

properties.notes_pt: Partida tardia esse dia pois de manh√£ estava em Parna√≠ba resenhando com o Leo e comprei c√¢maras novas pra Nat (por ter dado pt numa e danificado de leve outra). Almocei e descansei logo ap√≥s a divisa PI/MA. Segui com o sol j√° mais fraco at√© o fim do dia, pernoitei num posto de gasolina em Cana-Brava, onde fui muito bem acolhido pelos frentistas.
properties.notes_en: Late start that day, as I spent the morning in Parna√≠ba chatting with Leo and buying new tubes for Nat (since one was ruined and another slightly damaged). I had lunch and rested just after crossing the Piau√≠‚ÄìMaranh√£o border. Then I continued with the sun already lower until the end of the day, spending the night at a gas station in Cana-Brava, where I was warmly welcomed by the attendants.

properties.notes_pt: A manh√£ de pedal rendeu com 60 km at√© Paulino Neves. A princ√≠pio eu seguiria pela rodovia at√© Barreirinhas, mas conversando com um local, acabei seguindo a recomenda√ß√£o dele e fui pela praia do Barro Vermelho e seguindo 15 km pela areia firme da mar√© seca at√© a praia do Cabur√©, onde vi um belo p√¥r do sol sobre o Rio Pregui√ßa e tomei um banho de rio muito bem-vindo. Pernoitei num restaurante da praia que estava fechado e vazio. O c√©u estrelado estava incr√≠vel ‚ú®Ô∏è
properties.notes_en: The morning ride was productive, with 60 km to Paulino Neves. Initially, I was going to take the highway to Barreirinhas, but after talking to a local, I followed his recommendation and went along Barro Vermelho Beach, then continued 15 km on firm sand during low tide until Cabur√© Beach, where I witnessed a beautiful sunset over the Pregui√ßa River and enjoyed a refreshing river bath. I spent the night at a beach restaurant that was closed and empty. The starry sky was incredible ‚ú®Ô∏è.

properties.notes_pt: De manh√£ pedalei os √∫ltimos poucos km at√© a ponta da praia, no encontro do rio com o mar. Consegui um transporte de barquinho pra atravessar pra Atins, vento muito forte (kitesurf rolando) e ondas, molhando tudo. Passeei um pouco por Atins, almocei, descansei numa rede de frente pro rio/mar, e inesperadamente conectei com o Kayan√£, camarada que eu conheci ano passado em Alter do Ch√£o e mora em Atins. Ele e sua m√£e Carla gentilmente me receberam na casa deles. Kayan√£ me levou de quadriciclo com bike e tudo. No fim de tarde caminhei nas dunas pra ver o p√¥r do sol. Na volta um adolescente de quadriciclo me deu carona. De noite ainda deu pra ver o Flamengo amassar o Botafogo.
properties.notes_en: In the morning, I cycled the last few kilometers to the tip of the beach, where the river meets the sea. I got a small boat ride across to Atins ‚Äî with strong wind (lots of kitesurfing) and waves splashing everywhere. I wandered around Atins a bit, had lunch, and rested in a hammock facing the river and sea. Unexpectedly, I reconnected with Kayan√£, a friend I met last year in Alter do Ch√£o who lives in Atins. He and his mother, Carla, kindly welcomed me into their home. Kayan√£ took me on his quad bike with my bicycle. In the late afternoon, I walked through the dunes to watch the sunset. On the way back, a teenager on a quad gave me a ride. That night, I even managed to watch Flamengo crush Botafogo.

properties.notes_pt: Manh√£ tranquila na casa de Carla e Kayan√£ em Atins. Umas 12h30 peguei uma Toyota pra Barreirinhas com Augustinho (70 contos foi salgado, pre√ßo do turista e extra pela bike). Chegando, tive um almo√ßo tardio, fiz algumas comprinhas e me preparei pra seguir viagem.
properties.notes_en: A calm morning at Carla and Kayan√£‚Äôs house in Atins. Around 12:30 p.m. I took a Toyota truck to Barreirinhas with Augustinho (70 bucks ‚Äî quite pricey, tourist rate plus extra for the bike). Once there, I had a late lunch, did some shopping, and got ready to continue the journey.

properties.notes_pt: Ap√≥s o almo√ßo tardio em Barreirinhas, parti pra pedalar cerca de 60 km por volta das 16h. A vantagem foi o tempo fresco, mas pela primeira vez pedalei √† noite, cerca de uma hora ap√≥s o p√¥r do sol. Enfim cheguei no posto CH, tomei banho, mas acabei dormindo no restaurante ao lado, que era melhor pra armar a rede e onde a dona me recebeu muito bem.
properties.notes_en: After a late lunch in Barreirinhas, I set off to ride about 60 km around 4 p.m. The advantage was the cooler weather, but for the first time I rode at night ‚Äî about an hour after sunset. Finally, I arrived at the CH gas station, took a shower, and ended up sleeping in the restaurant next door, which was better for hanging my hammock and where the owner kindly welcomed me.

properties.notes_pt: Ap√≥s uma estadia curta por√©m intensa em Bel√©m, peguei o barco para Santar√©m. properties.notes_en: After a short but intense stay in Bel√©m, I took the boat to Santar√©m. It was two and a half very calm days ‚Äî resting in the hammock, reading, watching movies, writing, observing the forest (occasionally spotting a river dolphin), and chatting with other passengers. During the stop in Breves I bought a liter of a√ßa√≠ for only 10 reais, though it was a bit watery. On the third and last night I had some annoying stomach pain. properties.notes_en: I spent two and a half wonderful weeks in Alter! I volunteered at Don Pregui√ßa Hostel with Marlene, Thea, and Hermes. A peaceful routine of work, beach time at CAT or Lago Verde, and occasional outings. It was great to see friends who passed through: Pilar, Diego, and Chlo√©. I did a hike with an overnight stay in the Tapaj√≥s National Forest, enjoyed refreshing igarap√© baths, and visited Pindobal Beach. I celebrated my birthday ‚Äî Thea even made a delicious carrot cake! ‚Äî and we watched Flamengo win the Libertadores, with celebrations at a carimb√≥ event afterwards. My second time in Alter and at Don only strengthened how much I love this place.

properties.notes_pt: De volta a Santar√©m para pegar o barco para Manaus, com emo√ß√£o: o pneu furou no caminho e temi perder o barco. Ainda retirei os alforges novos imperme√°veis que meus pais me deram de anivers√°rio ‚Äî v√£o ser bem √∫teis para essa temporada de chuvas que est√° come√ßando.
properties.notes_en: Back in Santar√©m to catch the boat to Manaus ‚Äî with some excitement, since I got a flat tire on the way and feared missing the boat. I also picked up my new waterproof panniers, a birthday gift from my parents ‚Äî they‚Äôll be very useful for this upcoming rainy season.

properties.notes_pt: Dois dias de barco tranquilos pelo Rio Amazonas, com Thea e Alban, que conheci em Alter ‚Äî mas Alban acabou ficando doente, e depois descobrimos que era dengue üò¨. N√≥s tr√™s dividimos um airbnb por duas noites; depois eles seguiram viagem e eu fui ficar com minha tia F√°tima, que coincidentemente estava em Manaus a trabalho. Pude ficar no hotel dela, bastante luxuoso e com √≥timas refei√ß√µes. Tamb√©m passeamos pela cidade, fomos √† manifesta√ß√£o Mulheres Vivas e assistimos a espet√°culos no Teatro Amazonas ‚Äî muito bom! Gostei de conhecer a Clarissa e o Ademar, amigos da F√°tima.
properties.notes_en: Two calm days by boat along the Amazon River, with Thea and Alban, whom I met in Alter ‚Äî though Alban got sick, and we later found out it was dengue üò¨. The three of us shared a airbnb for two nights; then they continued their journey, and I went to stay with my aunt F√°tima, who happened to be in Manaus for work. I was able to stay at her hotel, quite luxurious and with great meals. We also explored the city, went to the 'Mulheres Vivas' demonstration, and saw performances at the Amazon Theatre ‚Äî really great! I also enjoyed meeting Clarissa and Ademar, F√°tima‚Äôs friends.

properties.notes_pt: Enfim retomando a estrada pra valer ap√≥s um m√™s e meio de pouco pedal (que foi √≥timo para descansar). Sa√≠ tarde no calor√£o de Manaus e, logo com 10 km, ainda na cidade, j√° furei o pneu ‚Äî de novo na parte interna da c√¢mara (como nas √∫ltimas vezes). Fiz o remendo, coloquei uma fita de borracha entre o aro e a c√¢mara, e calibrei o pneu em 60 psi (mais alto). Tomara que segure bem assim üôè Enfim cheguei √† famosa BR-174, que vou seguir por v√°rios dias ‚Äî a √∫nica liga√ß√£o com Roraima. Comecei a fazer um servi√ßo de mapeamento dos caf√©s e restaurantes na beira da BR em troca do almo√ßo, pro dono do restaurante onde comi. Ele vai colocar no mapa para outros viajantes. Segui sem incidentes at√© o km 41, onde h√° uma vilinha, e pernoitei no mezanino de uma borracharia. Quando tirei minha bagagem, o bagageiro ‚Äî que j√° era motivo de preocupa√ß√£o por estar rachado em v√°rios pontos ‚Äî quebrou feio. Tomei meu banho (na borracharia mesmo), fiz minha massa e deixei pra resolver de manh√£.
properties.notes_en: Finally back on the road for real after a month and a half of little cycling (which was great for resting). I left late under Manaus‚Äô scorching heat, and after just 10 km ‚Äî still in the city ‚Äî I got another flat, once again on the inner side of the tube (like the last few times). I patched it, added a rubber strip between the rim and the tube, and inflated it to 60 psi (a bit higher). Hopefully it holds up well üôè I finally reached the famous BR-174, which I‚Äôll follow for several days ‚Äî the only road connection to Roraima. I started a little project mapping roadside caf√©s and restaurants along the BR in exchange for meals, for the restaurant owner where I ate; he‚Äôll add it to a map for other travelers. Continued without issues until km 41, where there‚Äôs a small village, and spent the night in the mezzanine of a tire repair shop. When I removed my luggage, the rack ‚Äî already a concern due to several cracks ‚Äî broke badly. Took a shower (right there at the shop), cooked my pasta, and left the problem to solve in the morning.

properties.notes_pt: De manh√£, na borracharia ao lado, com a ajuda de um cara conseguimos improvisar um conserto no bagageiro usando dois vergalh√µes de a√ßo e abra√ßadeiras ‚Äî e sustentou. Segui viagem e parei para almo√ßar pouco antes de come√ßar uma chuva forte que durou bastante. Enfim cheguei em Presidente Figueiredo e acampei nos fundos de um posto na entrada da cidade. No dia seguinte, a prioridade foi resolver o bagageiro: rodei a cidade e encontrei o Guto, que tinha um bagageiro velho. Conseguimos fix√°-lo por cima do antigo com borrachas ‚Äî ficou um verdadeiro Frankenstein kkk, mas o importante √© que ficou s√≥lido. √Ä tarde fui √† Cachoeira das Orqu√≠deas, muito boa. Como n√£o encontrei um lugar melhor, voltei para o mesmo posto para acampar. A √∫ltima manh√£ foi bem tranquila, mas na hora de sair o pneu furou de novo‚Ä¶ acabei perdendo o come√ßo da final do Mundial enquanto remendava. Flamengo perdeu para o PSG nos p√™naltis.
properties.notes_en: In the morning, at the tire shop next door, with the help of a guy we improvised a fix for the rack using two steel rods and clamps ‚Äî and it held. I continued riding and stopped for lunch just before a heavy rain started, which lasted quite a while. I eventually arrived in Presidente Figueiredo and camped behind a gas station at the city entrance. The next day, fixing the rack was the priority: I rode around and finally found Guto, who had an old rack. We managed to secure it on top of the old one with rubber straps ‚Äî a real Frankenstein setup lol, but solid, which is what mattered. In the afternoon I visited Cachoeira das Orqu√≠deas, really nice. Not finding a better spot, I returned to the same gas station to camp. The last morning was very calm, but right when I left I got another flat tire‚Ä¶ I even missed the start of the Club World Cup final while patching it. Flamengo lost to PSG on penalties.

properties.notes_pt: Acabei saindo tarde de Presidente Figueiredo, por volta das 16h40, assumindo o risco de pedalar com a noite chegando numa estrada com longos trechos sem ponto de apoio. Pedalei quase uma hora ap√≥s o p√¥r do sol; j√° estava bem escuro, mas eu estava com as luzes ligadas. Felizmente o asfalto estava bom e a estrada n√£o era muito movimentada, mas segui sempre atento ao fluxo, especialmente de caminh√µes. Cheguei ao restaurante do Ga√∫cho, √† beira da estrada, que eu tinha visto no iOverlander. Jantei, tomei banho e armei minha rede ali mesmo ‚Äî ponto cl√°ssico de caminhoneiros. Descobri que existem caminh√µes que custam R$ 1,3 milh√£o ou mais. O Ga√∫cho √© gente boa e bom de papo, mas eu estava cansado e meio antissocial rs. Um caminhoneiro dormiu ao meu lado roncando forte.
properties.notes_en: I ended up leaving Presidente Figueiredo late, around 4:40 p.m., knowingly taking the risk of riding as night approached on a highway with long stretches without any support points. I rode for almost an hour after sunset; it was already quite dark, but I had my lights on. Fortunately, the asphalt was good and traffic was light, though I stayed very alert, especially with trucks. I arrived at Ga√∫cho‚Äôs roadside restaurant, which I had spotted on iOverlander. I had dinner, took a shower, and hung my hammock there ‚Äî a classic trucker stop. I learned that some trucks cost R$1.3 million or more. Ga√∫cho was friendly and chatty, but I was tired and a bit antisocial lol. A truck driver slept next to me, snoring loudly.

properties.notes_pt: Acordei cedo, mas estava chovendo forte e a chuva durou horas. Tomei o caf√© com calma, meditei e li na rede, e s√≥ fui sair quase √†s 10h. Felizmente a estrada ficou mais plana, ainda com algumas subidas e descidas, mas bem menos que nos dias anteriores. O tempo seguiu nublado, embora eu tenha me enganado e queimado os bra√ßos com o morma√ßo. Cheguei √† tarde na vila Abonari, a √∫ltima antes da Terra Ind√≠gena Waimiri Atroari, fiz algumas comprinhas e segui um pouco adiante at√© um restaurante, onde consegui comer e dormir, assim como no restaurante do Ga√∫cho. Agora me aguarda o maior desafio da viagem at√© agora: atravessar os 125 km da terra ind√≠gena, onde vou precisar me garantir na comida, na √°gua e na perna üòÖ. Preciso fazer tudo em um √∫nico dia, durante o dia, pois a perman√™ncia √† noite √© proibida ‚Äî e tamb√©m perigosa por causa das on√ßas.
properties.notes_en: I woke up early, but it was raining heavily and the rain lasted for hours. I had a slow breakfast, meditated, and read in my hammock, only setting off around 10 a.m. Luckily the road became flatter, still with some climbs and descents, but far fewer than on previous days. The weather stayed cloudy, though I fooled myself and ended up burning my arms in the muggy heat. I arrived in the afternoon at the village of Abonari, the last one before the Waimiri Atroari Indigenous Territory, did some shopping, and continued a bit further to a roadside restaurant, where I could eat and sleep, just like at Ga√∫cho‚Äôs place. Now the biggest challenge of the trip so far awaits me: crossing the 125 km of indigenous land, where I‚Äôll need to be fully self-sufficient with food, water, and legs üòÖ. I must do it all in one day, during daylight, since staying overnight is forbidden ‚Äî and also dangerous because of jaguars.

properties.notes_pt: Dia mais longo de pedal at√© aqui! 125 km pela terra ind√≠gena, das 7h √†s 16h. Logo na entrada, fui parado por guardas que quiseram assegurar que eu me garantia de atravessar tudo no pedal antes do anoitecer, tranquilizei eles que sim. Administrei bem o pedal, com v√°rios lanchinhos e tomando bastante √°gua e isot√¥nico caseiro (√°gua, tang, sal e lim√£o), curtindo a floresta e atento com o alto fluxo de caminh√µes. Felizmente sem incidentes, parei no primeiro posto de gasolina ap√≥s a TI pra pernoitar.
properties.notes_en: Longest day of cycling so far! 125 km through indigenous land, from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. Right at the entrance, I was stopped by guards who wanted to make sure I could complete the entire crossing by bike before nightfall; I reassured them that I could. I managed the ride well, with several small snacks and plenty of water and homemade electrolyte drink (water, Tang, salt, and lemon), enjoying the forest while staying alert due to the heavy truck traffic. Thankfully without incidents, I stopped at the first gas station after the Indigenous Territory to spend the night.

properties.place_name_pt: BR-174 (perto de Bela Vista), RR, Brasil
properties.notes_pt: Ap√≥s o longo pedal da v√©spera, foi √≥timo uma manh√£ mais tranquila. Fiquei quase 2h no telefone com a Carol, foi √≥timo botar o papo em dia. Fui come√ßar a pedalar quase meio dia s√≥, no calor. Ap√≥s uns 20 e poucos km, cruzei a linha do Equador! Tirei umas fotos no marco na beira da estrada. Agora a viagem segue no hemisf√©rio norte. Almocei num restaurante logo adiante. Muitas araras hoje, principalmente casais, e falando bastante, foi legal observ√°-las. Parei pra pernoitar num restaurante mais adiante. Ahh e hoje outro marco: completei 3000 km pedalados!
properties.notes_en: After the long ride the day before, it was great to have a calmer morning. I spent almost two hours on the phone with Carol, catching up properly. I only started riding close to noon, in the heat. After a little over 20 km, I crossed the Equator! I took some photos at the roadside marker. From now on, the journey continues in the Northern Hemisphere. I had lunch at a restaurant shortly after. Lots of macaws today, mostly in pairs and very vocal ‚Äî it was great to watch them. I stopped to spend the night at another restaurant further along. Oh, and another milestone today: I completed 3000 km cycled!

properties.notes_pt: Almocei em Nova Colina e fiquei empolgado pensando e escrevendo uma ideia de livro de fic√ß√£o que venho refletindo nas √∫ltimas semanas. De tarde eu tava pedalando mal prestando aten√ß√£o na estrada, com a cabe√ßa totalmente nisso. Enfim cheguei na entrada de Rorain√≥polis, primeiro parei num posto BR que tinha uns filhotes de cachorros muito fofos, mas n√£o me deixaram ficar l√° e acabei indo no posto seguinte, da Atem, onde acampei num matinho atr√°s do posto. Jantei meu macarr√£o no ar-condicionado da loja de conveni√™ncia, estava passando a final da Copa do Brasil. Arrisquei n√£o botar a lona por cima da rede e de madrugada choveu, mas foi s√≥ por alguns instantes, o suficiente pra me acordar no susto. Tinha uma fam√≠lia de argentinos de kombi ali do lado tamb√©m.
properties.notes_en: I had lunch in Nova Colina and got excited thinking about and writing an idea for a fiction book I‚Äôve been reflecting on over the past few weeks. In the afternoon I was riding barely paying attention to the road, my mind completely focused on that. I eventually reached the entrance of Rorain√≥polis; first I stopped at a BR gas station that had some very cute puppies, but they didn‚Äôt let me stay, so I went to the next station, an Atem, where I camped in a patch of greenery behind it. I ate my pasta in the air-conditioned convenience store while the Copa do Brasil final was on. I took the risk of not putting the tarp over the hammock and during the night it rained, but only for a few moments‚Äîenough to wake me up with a scare. There was also a family of Argentinians in a Kombi parked nearby.

properties.notes_pt: Manh√£ tranquila at√© a Vila Nova Para√≠so, onde almocei e caiu uma chuva bem forte, por sorte evitei ela. Ali tamb√©m marcou o ponto em que me separei da 174, ap√≥s seguir ela desde Manaus. Dali pra Boa Vista seguiria a 432 por ser o caminho mais curto, achei bem tranquila, pouco fluxo, quase nenhum caminh√£o, asfalto bom. Ela s√≥ tem v√°rias pontes meio prec√°rias de madeira, motivo pelo qual muitos ve√≠culos evitam justamente. Parei no fim do dia na Vila Baruana, acampei numa escola desativada que tinha banheiro e uma bica. Mas n√£o tinha chuveiro. Sebastiana e Jos√© da vendinha ao lado me emprestaram uma mangueira pra tomar um banho. Comi l√° com eles trocando o ideia, Sebastiana amazonense e Jos√© piauiense, j√° rodou o Brasil todo vendendo livros. L√° tamb√©m conheci o Raimundo, que tava de passagem e me convidou pra passar o Natal com a fam√≠lia dele em Boa Vista! Lindo c√©u estrelado essa noite
properties.notes_en: A calm morning until Vila Nova Para√≠so, where I had lunch and a very heavy rain came down ‚Äî luckily I managed to avoid it. That also marked the point where I left BR-174 after following it since Manaus. From there to Boa Vista I took BR-432, the shortest route; I found it very peaceful, with little traffic, almost no trucks, and good asphalt. The only downside is several somewhat precarious wooden bridges, which is why many vehicles avoid it. At the end of the day I stopped in Vila Baruana and camped at a deactivated school that had a bathroom and a water tap, though no shower. Sebastiana and Jos√©, from the small shop next door, lent me a hose so I could take a bath. I ate there with them, chatting ‚Äî Sebastiana is from Amazonas and Jos√© from Piau√≠, who has traveled all over Brazil selling books. I also met Raimundo there, who was passing through and invited me to spend Christmas with his family in Boa Vista. Beautiful starry sky that night.

properties.notes_pt: Altos e baixos de um dia de estrada: Sebastiana trouxe tapiocas e caf√© pra mim ü´∂, pneu furou logo de manh√£, muitos cajueiros carregados na beira da estrada, enchi a bolsa de cajus. T√¥ curtindo fazer palavras cruzadas nas horas de descanso. Fim da tarde cheguei na Vila Santa Rita, segundo dia seguido sem chuveiro, dessa vez foi um banho de balde com uma bica na rua. Acampei num bar, tava confort√°vel e tal, a desvantagem foi ser bem perto da BR, com fluxo de carros perto e tal.
properties.notes_en: Ups and downs of a day on the road: Sebastiana brought me tapiocas and coffee ü´∂, I got a flat tire early in the morning, and there were many cashew trees loaded along the roadside ‚Äî I filled my bag with cashews. I‚Äôve been enjoying doing crossword puzzles during rest breaks. By late afternoon I arrived in Vila Santa Rita, my second consecutive day without a proper shower ‚Äî this time it was a bucket bath using a street water tap. I camped at a bar; it was comfortable, but the downside was being very close to the highway, with constant car traffic nearby.

properties.notes_pt: Enfim cheguei em Boa Vista! Pedro do CIR (que conheci atrav√©s do Reinaldo, que conheci pelo trabalho na umgrauemeio), me recebeu muito bem na casa dele, com sua filha Cec√≠lia, muito fofa. Trocamos bastante ideia sobre v√°rios assuntos, de pol√≠tica a geologia. Passei o Natal com a fam√≠lia do Raimundo que eu tinha conhecido 2 dias antes, foi bem divertido, fizeram v√°rias brincadeiras, at√© ganhei uma t√°bua (de cozinha) num leil√£o com dinheiro falso. Dia 25 fiquei s√≥ de boa descansando, foi √≥timo
properties.notes_en: I finally arrived in Boa Vista! Pedro from CIR (whom I met through Reinaldo, whom I met via my work at umgrauemeio) welcomed me warmly into his home, along with his very cute daughter Cec√≠lia. We had great conversations about many topics, from politics to geology. I spent Christmas with Raimundo‚Äôs family, whom I had met two days earlier ‚Äî it was a lot of fun, with games and activities, and I even won a cutting board at an auction using fake money. On the 25th I just relaxed and rested, which was great.

properties.notes_pt: No dia 25 √† noite, fomos para o s√≠tio da Auriane, amiga do Pedro, e da dona Lenir, m√£e dela. Dormimos l√° de rede. Pedro foi ajudar a implantar um sistema de irriga√ß√£o para as planta√ß√µes delas. Ficamos l√° o dia seguinte todo. Passeei de caiaque no rio, foi uma del√≠cia. Dona Lenir preparou um √≥timo almo√ßo e cochilamos depois. De tarde ajudei um pouco Pedro e Auriane com o posicionamento dos tubos de irriga√ß√£o. J√° de noite voltamos para Boa Vista.
properties.notes_en: On the night of the 25th, we went to the rural property of Auriane, a friend of Pedro, and her mother Dona Lenir. We slept there in hammocks. Pedro went to help install an irrigation system for their crops. We stayed there the entire following day. I went kayaking on the river, which was delightful. Dona Lenir prepared a great lunch and we took a nap afterward. In the afternoon, I helped Pedro and Auriane a bit with positioning the irrigation pipes. At night, we returned to Boa Vista.
